yaml.title: Week 04 Overview
yaml.subtitle: Keep on keeping on - Critical Proposal

markdown.markdown:
```{=html}

<iframe src="https://ps52007d.littlemonkeylab.com/slides/week04/lecture.slides.html" title="Week 04 Lecture" width="960" height="500" data-external="1"></iframe>
```
## Introduction & Lecture Preview

::: {.callout .primary}
**Key Focus:** Considering what you bring to psychology, 3 flavours of
ANOVA, and your personal MD design
:::

-   **Important Points:**
    1.  Focus continues on the Critical Proposal
    2.  Get your Lab Tutor to verify it's a good choice
-   **Preparatory Reading or Thinking:**
    -   Just keep reading. The answer to all the questions you have
        right now is 'read more'

## Lab Sessions

```{=html}

<iframe src="https://ps52007d.littlemonkeylab.com/slides/week04/lab.slides.html" title="Week 04 lab overview" width="960" height="500" data-external="1"></iframe>
```
## Primary Thought

-   Review the example Critical Proposal in the Coursework Information
    section of the VLE
    <https://learn.gold.ac.uk/mod/folder/view.php?id=1379980>
-   It got a first, but has lots of room for improvement.
-   Last year, the Effect Size and Design Schematic were NOT required.
    This year they are COMPULSORY.
-   Remember, 70% of the mark is for Critical Evaluation, 30% for
    Reflective engagement and talking about your planned research

### Main Lab Activities

-   Keep moving forwards with Critical Evaluation
-   Continue refining your research ideas. It's a nice change from
    reading and detail work

### Module Milestones (by end of this week)

-   You will have confirmed your Target Paper is a good one.
-   You will be happy with some element of your Design (IV(A), IV(B) or
    your DV) or it may be your task. Get it down on paper.

### Reflection and Meta-Cognitive Practice

How confident do you feel identifying something in the 'literature' that
is reliable, feasible, accessible, and of high quality?

Is it a bit more difficult than it should be? If so, what help do you
need/want? How might you find that support?

language.appendix-attribution-cite-as: For attribution, please cite this work as:

instructor.name: Dr. Gordon Wright
instructor.contact_policy: E-mail is the best ways to get in contact with me. I will try to respond to all course-related e-mails within 24 hours. Any questions relating to the course, coursework or anything not personal/confidential in nature should be submitted to the Course Forum. This benefits all students. So, if you email me about the course, don't be surprised if you get a brief 'Please post this to the Forum' message!   Office hours are advertised on the module VLE page.
